intro: Planchonella auahiensis, commonly known as the Maui hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a leathery texture with a rough surface. Planchonella auahiensis is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Hawaii, including its tropical climate and nutrient-poor soils.
